intro: Laennecia coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's laennecia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
